arts.ttl: Hatters CEO reveals Luton have submitted 'sizeable bids' during transfer window
arts.sum: Town need reinforcements after yet another Championship defeat

arts.ttl: Bloomfield understands crowd reaction as Luton's players are booed off after Millwall loss
arts.sum: Town suffer a sixth defeat from seven Championship matches

arts.ttl: The lowdown on Millwall 1 Luton 0 - Crama settles straight in at right-back as Ivanovic stunner seals overdue Kenilworth Road victory
arts.sum: Millwall: Jensen (Roberts 90), Crama, Tanganga, Cooper, Bryan, Saville, De Norre, Watmore (Honeyman 83), Bangura-Williams, Scanlon (Connolly 17), Ivanovic. Luton Town: Kaminski, Bell, Andersen, McGuinness, Hashioka, Nakamba (Walsh 75), Brown (Nelson 67), Krauss (Adebayo 61), Clark, Doughty (Jones 68), Morris.

arts.ttl: Millwall boss Neil isn’t interested in points gap to Championship drop zone after 1-0 win at Luton Town
arts.sum: Alex Neil was delighted to get his first Championship win as Millwall head coach as his side claimed a 1-0 victory at Luton Town on Saturday lunchtime. “I don’t know what the gap loo ks like at the moment – it’s no t my focus – my focus is on our performance,” said Neil.

arts.ttl: Millwall edge win at struggling Luton
arts.sum: Millwall ramped up the pressure on struggling Luton by picking up a first away win since October with a 1-0 victory at Kenilworth Road.

arts.ttl: Pressure builds on Luton after defeat to Millwall
arts.sum: It was the Lions’ first away win since October.

arts.ttl: Andersen and Doughty return as Luton make four changes for Millwall
Bloomfield backs 'unplayable' Adebayo and striker partner Morris to come good for Luton
arts.sum: Town forward duo have struggled for goals this season

arts.ttl: No signs of fatigue for Nakamba as Luton midfielder looks to start a fifth successive game
arts.sum: Zimbabwean international is becoming a first team regular once more

arts.ttl: Luton Town in ‘advanced talks’, player can leave ‘quickly’ – Want to get ahead of Norwich and West Brom
arts.sum: Luton Town, Norwich City and West Bromwich Albion are among the clubs in the picture to sign FC St. Gallen star Willem Geubbels in the winter market. That’s according to Foot Mercato, who tag Norwich City and West Brom when covering the latest on Luton Town.
